p: The age profile of infection can be framed mathematically [ 33], and parameters describing contacts between individuals of different ages inferred [ 31]. The resulting estimated matrix of contacts over age is known as the Who-Acquires-Infection-from-Whom or WAIFW matrix. Alternatively, patterns of contacts between individuals can be directly measured [ 34], for example, using diary studies (Fig. 5.6); and by combining this with the age profile of infection within the population, the force of infection over age can be inferred [ 35].
